comment:
Prof. Dr. Jordan B. Peterson was asking the AI bot if they were trained with political bias that favored politicians who would lie about the big things with larger consequences rather than lie only about menial things such as paying off a porn star not to reveal that he had had an extra marital affair with them.

Peterson could have just as easily asked if President Let's Go Brandon had extremely high mental competency when he claimed that his overspending policies would NOT fuel that inflation increase from 1.6% to 8%+ after the policies were enacted, or if starting a proxy war with Russian through Ukraine was wise given that it increased the chances that he could start WW3 soon afterward, or about the inflation caused by Let's Go Brandon could cause the US Federal Reserve note dollars become HUGELY less favored as the world reserve currency when everyone holding bonds or T-Bills or bank accounts having that currency were driven to lose significant value compounding yearly as time went forward?

Or if instituting cultural Marxism in the form of Wokeness in Western society was wise given that it greatly reduced the competency of society in key areas of national security, war preparedness, business competency, and that greatly increased the chances that the WEF great reset would happen sooner than later, thereby devaluing the value of all property currently owned by American citizens and businesses that would lead to environmental social and governance (ESG) score imposed big brother surveillance nanny state of everyone's spending patterns by means of central bank digital currency that would institute micromanaging a Marxist ESG scoring system to impose a backward dystopian future upon everyone, even those having no net debts.

comment: @cellowify  History means absolutely nothing when it comes to companies. You claimed they are "one of the most monopolistic companies in the world." This is laughably wrong in 2023. They literally have no monopoly on anything. Windows has Marketshare, but almost nothing important is tied to Windows anymore. If you want to whine about actual monopolies with power, look at Google or a lesser extent, iPhone. Or to put it another way, name one area of life where Microsoft has power. You can't, because it's 2023, not 1993. This said, they're actually showing some signs of life with their OpenAI partnership.

comment:
Here’s the Eminem version

If you want to turn the song into a rap song featuring Eminem, you can try changing the lyrics to fit a more hip-hop style and beat. Here's a possible updated version of the song:

Verse 1:
Listen up, it's time to praise
Three wise men who light the way
Lex, Sam, and Don, they bring the truth
Their insights sharp, their knowledge proof

Chorus:
Sing it loud, let it be heard
Their wisdom's tight, no need for words
With minds like steel and hearts of gold
These three legends will never fold

Verse 2:
Lex is quick, he's got the wit
To make you laugh and to make you think
His lectures fire up the brain
And leave you never quite the same

Chorus:
Sing it loud, let it be heard
Their wisdom's tight, no need for words
With minds like steel and hearts of gold
These three legends will never fold

Verse 3:
Don's got a theory like no other
About the fabric of reality's cover
With conscious realism, he's explored
The deepest mysteries of our world

Chorus:
Sing it loud, let it be heard
Their wisdom's tight, no need for words
With minds like steel and hearts of gold
These three legends will never fold

Verse 4:
Sam's got logic like a sharp knife
His arguments could end your life
With insights deep and clear as day
He shows us how to break away

Chorus:
Sing it loud, let it be heard
Their wisdom's tight, no need for words
With minds like steel and hearts of gold
These three legends will never fold

Verse 5:
So let's give props to these three kings
Who bring us truth and everything
Lex, Sam, and Don, they're on the rise
And we'll never forget their wise advice

Chorus:
Sing it loud, let it be heard
Their wisdom's tight, no need for words
With minds like steel and hearts of gold
These three legends will never fold.

author: @MiqelDotCom

comment:
I found the conversation between Lex and Sam on creativity, AGI, and consciousness to be fascinating. This paper is a summary of my three-year lectures on computational consciousness at Stanford, and I would love to receive feedback on it. One crucial element for enabling all of these topics is perhaps the existence of free will, guarded by ethics. Without some degree of freedom to speculate beyond what is known, creativity does not seem possible.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eOY-hEJYYduEZlWCdTENN6kj_Z69pyrK/view
author: @eyuchang

comment:
Thank you for this.
Q: What would you ask to a future version of yourself to determine if it is conscious of itself?
A: As an AI language model, I do not have a "self" or consciousness, but I can suggest some questions that may help determine if a future version of yourself is conscious of themselves:

What is your subjective experience of existence like?
Do you have thoughts and feelings that are unique to you?
Can you reflect on your own thoughts and emotions?
Are you aware of your own body and how it interacts with the environment?
Do you have a sense of agency and control over your actions?
Can you imagine different scenarios and plan accordingly?
Are you capable of learning from experience and adapting to new situations?
Do you have a sense of identity and self-awareness?
Can you differentiate between yourself and others?
Do you have a sense of purpose or meaning in your life?

comment:
If we think human institutional an are going to be capable of managing this that seems very optimistic. Institutions can even handle tik Tok, Twitter, or greedy corporations who suck the profits out of society and don’t pay taxes. Do we really think politicians will be able to regulate AGI , they don’t even get Facebook, they can’t regulate banks . Instead of letting the market run its course they bail out failing banks which is like giving an addict more money when they run out. 

Explain the confidence being communicated here as to why people are going to be able to regulate a technology that is the most advanced thing ever created. Are they going to ask the AI to create rules for governing the AI
